title: Harrington Rare Disease Scholar Award
desc: Deadline: 09-Mar-2026 The Oxford–Harrington Rare Disease Scholar Award supports early-stage academic discoveries with strong potential to become patient-ready therapies for rare diseases. The programme provides £100,000 or USD 100,000 in funding, hands-on therapeutics development support, and access to advanced research infrastructure to accelerate translation into clinical practice. title: Neighborhood disadvantage accelerates biological aging through emotional distress
desc: While scientists have long known that living in a disadvantaged neighborhood is associated with biological symptoms of accelerated aging, emotional distress accounts for a significant portion of these effects, researchers found in a recent study.

title: Nipah virus: Health Ministry to screen travellers from high-risk countries
desc: BANGI: The Health Ministry is conducting targeted screening of travellers arriving in Malaysia from high-risk countries, particularly India and Bangladesh, as an initial measure to strengthen the country's preparedness against the potential spread of the Nipah virus.

title: From questionable credibility to bias, the shame of Judiciary being reduced to loyalty test
desc: Isaac Ruto has been accused of attending UDA meetings, including a recent NGC gathering at State House, actions termed “unprecedented for a JSC Commissioner.”

title: Man charged with New Year's Day murder of Pukehina woman
desc: Police were called to a property in western Bay of Plenty around 3pm on January 1, where a woman was found dead.

title: Wembanyama scores 28 points to lead Spurs past Rockets, 111-99
desc: Victor Wembanyama had 28 points, 16 rebounds and five blocks to help the San Antonio Spurs rally for a 111-99 victory over the Houston Rockets on Wednesday night.

title: Hastie and Taylor fail to agree on plan to oust Ley despite clandestine meeting
desc: The two conservative men vying to replace Sussan Ley as leader of the Liberal Party met in Melbourne before attending a memorial service for their former colleague Katie Allen.
